attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Do not ban fireworks to the public but increase the age of sale to 25 minimum.
attributes.background: Thousands of people respectively enjoy garden fireworks and use them accordingly, why should the whole nation have that taken away from them because of a few peoples irresponsible use of fireworks? It's not fair that everyone should pay because of a few.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks have been used since the 12th century, animals and people have coped fine, animal owners have information widely available to them to help their animals cope. Lifting the age of sale to 25 will help stop the irresponsible use of fireworks. It is simply not fair to spoil it for everyone because of a few!

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Make the 6 week holidays shorter by spreading the weeks throughout the year.
attributes.background: The 6 week holidays are far too long and children get sluggish at the start of the new term. School grades and attitudes towards school should improve as more time learning.

attributes.action: I would like the Government to reinstate Child Support Agency!
attributes.background: We need a government run Child Support Agency as the so called Child Maintenance Service is not meeting the correct criteria. Causing a high level of financial suffering for the parent who is raising the child/children. The absent parent is not being forced to supply correct financial  information.

attributes.action: Stop the addictive drug Codeine being sold as an over the counter medicine.
attributes.background:
Many people are finding themselves taking Codeine on a regular basis through over the counter pain killers and cough medicine even when symptoms have stopped.
Codeine is an Opiate drug.
Despite fairly recent warnings on the packets and from sales assistants, people are becoming addicted.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on Codeine addiction and where to get help can be found online.
Many people are using these drugs to relax, get to sleep etc and becoming dependant.
This is a serious problem and health issue with a suprising amount of people finding themselves addicted and sales of these drugs are increasing.
Making these drugs prescription only and providing help for people who have become addicted would be a simple solution to the problem, manufacturers are the only ones benefitting from it.

attributes.action: change the law on websites listing companies without the owners permission
attributes.background: Parliament needs to change the law on how websites list companies without the company owners permission. It should be up to the business owner to decide where and how their business is displayed and advertised, and be removed from any website at the owners request.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for realistic road crash simulations of child car seats
attributes.background: Having done countless hours of research on car seats, I purchased a Nuna Rebl for my son based on positive reviews. However, it has now been listed as a dangerous car seat, yet meets the UN ECE R129 standards. Worryingly, these standards are extremely poor, and not representative of actual crashes.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently UN UCE R129 standards require seats to perform well in the following, totally unrealistic, crash simulations: 
Front impact: 31 mph
Rear impact: 18.6 mph
Side impact: 14.9 mph
These of course are not representative of many car accidents. If you hit another car head on, both driving at 20mph (a lower speed limit than in most residential areas), there will be a 40mph impact, which isn't covered by the existing required testing, putting children's lives at risk.

attributes.action: Mandatory Client Money Protection for Letting Agents
attributes.background: The Government is less than lukewarm about making it mandatory that all Landlord and Tenant money is safely held in Client Accounts and covered by insurance policies. Some of our present Landlords have lost thousands with agents that have closed down and run off with money they banked from Tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
A solicitor, conveyancer or even a financial adviser is not afforded the same trust. Unfortunately the small minority of agents do, often, run away with large sums of money!

Why are we as agents so poorly regulated?

Further discussion and details here: https://www.aaronjbarclay.co.uk/should-client-money-protection-be-mandatory. Estate agents in London and beyond should be made to comply.

Please sign if you feel this is a worthy petition.

attributes.action: Require manufacturers & suppliers to label reduction in size/volume of a product
attributes.background: Since the economic downturn in 2009, manufacturers & suppliers of food & other consumer goods such as washing liquids have been reducing the size or volume of products whilst maintaining the same selling price or increasing it. This results in the consumer paying more money for less goods.
attributes.additional_details: Often the reductions are so subtle, that a consumer is unaware that anything has changed. This practice is misleading & unfair & it is time that manufacturers & suppliers are required to clearly mark a reduction in size or volume. This practice has made the weekly shop much more expensive & by labelling the reduction in size, consumers will be better informed to look at alternative products that may offer better value for money. See examples in this Daily Mail article: https://goo.gl/0aUpQF

attributes.action: Restrict private parking charges to reasonable amounts.
attributes.background: It is proposed that the government amend the Protection of Freedom Act 2014 to restrict the amount a private company can issue a parking charge to a fair and reasonable amount and no more than what the local council can issue a penalty notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Every day many parking charge notices are issued to vehicles parking on private land. Normally, the fee to cover the car is a reasonable nominal amount. However, for those that overstay the period the vehicle is covered or parking the car without any cover the charges are unreasonable and far more than the loss of business the proprietor suffers. 

The everyday person in the United Kingdom that uses parking facilities lawfully but from time to time cannot cover their car for entirely adequate reasons are suffering unreasonable financial burdens.

attributes.action: If 20% of a workforce are claiming tax credits  no dividend to shareholders
attributes.background: Any Company  paying its workers so low that they are subsidizing their wages with tax credits, should be barred from paying a dividend. The taxpayer should not be propping up greedy bosses that should  be paying correct wages  to the workers not  to shareholders

attributes.action: Make the UK a permanent armed neutral country like Switzerland.
attributes.background: Since Switzerland became an armed neutral power in 1815 the UK has approximately been involved in 50 conflicts and lost 1,540,462 UK military and civilian life's (20 of those conflicts and 7456 lifes have been lost since WW2).
attributes.additional_details: Becoming an armed nurtality country, would still enable us to keep our armed forces and deter or counter any invasion force to the UK or any overseas British territory.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to set up sports teams for both genders.
attributes.background:
"Rugby is for boys," "Netball is for girls." 
Gender inequality in sport exists in schools, clubs and at the elite level.
All pupils should be encouraged to take part in any sport.  How hard is it to set up a rugby team for boys and a rugby team for girls? 
You can make a change!

attributes.action: Ban Votes for anyone over the age of 70
attributes.background: In the referendum most young people- 17 or below did not have the chance to decide their future, where old pensioners were allowed to vote and decide our future for us! We want more control for young people!
attributes.additional_details: Such as in the referendum, despite a petetion and growing debate for votes for 16 year olds, the number of old people is on the increase, due to the baby boomers getting older! Therefore to restrict the age this way it would help keep down the number of old people voting and put more decision in the younger generations.

attributes.action: Give employees rights post-probation so they can't be unfairly sacked
attributes.background: I was recently dismissed without my boss following disciplinary procedures. Employees only get job protection after two years, making it easy for SMEs to dismiss staff for unfair reasons. The law needs updating to protect the millions of people employed post probation until they reach two years.
attributes.additional_details:
On the Gov.UK website it states - Before taking any action, your employer should: follow disciplinary procedures or give you a chance to improve 

Small businesses accounted for 99.3% of all private sector businesses at the start of 2015 with 15.6 million people employed by SMEs. After seeking legal advice on the subject ACAS disciplinary procedures only apply after two years. So small businesses do not need to apply these and can unceremoniously make it easy to dismiss staff.

attributes.action: Give the HSE more powers under the law to regulate gas safety for consumers.
attributes.background: A recent Which? investigation showed that engineers failed to provide boiler servicing which is safe and meets minimum requirements for the job. Of the 6 'big companies' and 4 independent companies checked 70% failed to meet minimum legal requirements. The HSE need legal powers to be effective.
attributes.additional_details:
The Health & Safety Executive must be able to hold Gas Safe and it's engineers to account and ensure Gas Safe registered engineers:

1} are competent to complete a full, safe boiler service, with regular checks on performance

2} have a legal minimum boiler service time

3} complete a clear, detailed report

4} are held to account in the same way as other professions which potentially risk peoples lives

5} HSE should complete robust checks on standards of work & update the registration process.

attributes.action: Allow TV coverage of Saturday 3PM Premier League Matches
attributes.background: In 1964 Burnley chairman Bob Lord was convinced that televising football on a Saturday afternoon would have a detrimental effect on attendances to stadiums. As such, he created a movement to prevent showing these games,  which still stands today.
attributes.additional_details:
I find this notion to be far outdated, especially if you consider these games are shown all over the world apart from where they're being played?! Then consider the rising cost of premium TV services such as Sky and BT Sport yet consumers are not even receiving coverage of half the premier league games. 

I empathise with the desire to keep fans going to the game, I really do. So I'm proposing something similar to the NFL Blackout policy that requires all tickets to be sold 72 hours prior to kickoff or no TV coverage

attributes.action: Make the buying age of tobacco products 16+.
attributes.background:
The minimum age was 16 years of prior to 1994. 
Plus we can smoke at 16 but not buy it? this makes no sense and needs to be changed asap.

attributes.action: Standardise ID requirements for all public and quasi-public bodies
attributes.background: At present any public authority (or quasi public authority such as a utility company or railway) can randomly select what ID requirements are needed from members of the public to interact with them.  Surely this could be standardised for all such institutions through very simple legislation.
attributes.additional_details: For instance some PAs (eg the Bank of England if you want to exchange old bank notes) will accept a driver's licence as proof over address, others (eg my local authority issuing a parking permit) will only accept a utility bill less than 3 months old and not if it is copied from an on-line bill.   NB this is NOT a request for introduction of compulsory ID cards.

attributes.action: £500 tax allowance,every 4 yrs for sport for either membership fee or equipment.
attributes.background: To capitalize on the excitement of the Olympics, every 4 yrs a £500 tax free allowance per person could be allocated to spend on  either sports membership (golf for an example) or sport equipment. This will prevent certain sports being only available to the well off.

attributes.action: Introduce a Mandatory 10 year prison sentence for Vehicle theft/ involvement in.
attributes.background: The people of Great Britain are sick of working hard to buy vehicles, only to have them stolen by criminals who do not care. The impact of their crimes affect thousands of people, who suffer untold hardship, financial loss & emotional distress due to crime. The law needs to be a major deterrent.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the penalty for stealing a vehicle does not fit the crime, many criminals walk free from court with punitive punishments, despite causing huge problems for the victims of their crime.

The law needs to ensure that theft of a vehicle is so harshly punished it will make it unappealing.

attributes.action: Manual workers to retire at 60!!
attributes.background:
We work until we drop!! Is that the idea? Myself and my partner are both manual workers and are 57 years old!! We really can't see ourselves being fit to work until we're 66!! Can you? We're ready to drop now.

Please vote.
attributes.additional_details: Manual workers are more at risk for potential damage to limb and arthritis damage so therefore would cost more in the long run for medical deficiency!! Most of us will end up taking sick leave because we can't manage our jobs. Personally I have worked since I was 14 and am now 57. Is this not long enough!!!

attributes.action: Government to reform the honours system to include posthumous awards
attributes.background: I'm creating this petition to call upon the Government to reform the honours system, so that knighthoods can be awarded posthumously. Its a shame that people that have contributed something for the country but are sadly no longer with us cannot be recognised for their achievements.
attributes.additional_details: A prime example is Bobby Moore. Its now the 50th anniversary of the year of England winning the world cup. He was a leader, a gentleman and credit to this country. Geoff Hurst has been knighted so surely Bobby Moore should be too (posthumously) as he was the Captain of the team, especially in this anniversary year. It would be a very fitting way to celebrate the achievement of the the man and the team.

attributes.action: Bring university fees down to £4.5 grand a year
attributes.background: People either can't or never pay the money if the government wants their money back they need to bring the fees down

attributes.action: Solution to restrict migration, whilst appeasing freedom of movement
attributes.background: All solutions on this issue will not please everyone, so neutral ground must be found. This I believe is a good solution to restrict the number of incoming EU nationals while maintaining freedom of movement to those who genuinely want to live & work in the UK, which in turn allows free trade with EU
attributes.additional_details:
•	All EU arrivals to the UK must complete 24 months of paid contributions to the state before receiving free NHS care 
•	Prior to completing the 24 months, all those who do not qualify for free state medical care must have a private European style health insurance policy
•	All foreign nationals wishing to transfer money overseas must pay a government stamp duty or tax
•	EU nationals claiming benefits, a maximum of 20% of income into the account is allowed to be transferred outside of the UK

attributes.action: Make all pest problems the landlord or home owners responsibility
attributes.background: landlords and home owners should be legally responsible for all pest problems within the building and not just ones that transmit diseases.

attributes.action: Offer discounted counselling to housing professionals.
attributes.background: The world of social housing is changing drastically. Everyday, housing professionals are presented with greater challenges due to welfare reform. While we are told to advocate greater mental health awareness, little or nothing is being done to protect those who work with most vulnerable in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the implementation of reforms such as the benefit cap and universal credit, the already emotionally draining work of housing professionals is becoming more demanding daily. We must now delve deeper into the lives of our customers and often discover horrific issues such as domestic abuse, child sexual exploitation and even dead bodies in our properties.
To help our customers through these issues we must become heavily involved and yet many are not receiving the emotional support necessary.

attributes.action: Change legislation for VED to weekly. DVLA gain 3 X payments every change.
attributes.background: Amend legislation from monthly vehicle tax to weekly. If a new car is bought privately that car will be taxed, and so will the buyers,neither transferable,but the purchased car will need re-taxed, in effect the DVLA are claiming three ( 3 ) times the duty on each car sold under these conditions.
attributes.additional_details: Currently if a car is legally taxed and driven on a road when it is written off or changed, the tax is cancelled, but duty paid for that month,a new car bought privately will be taxed also, but not transferable under current legislation.In effect the DVLA are penalizing motorists by raking in three ( 3 ) times the duty on each car sold under these conditions.Charging VEL on a weekly basis would be fairer, and as most transactions are made through the DVLA website it should be easy to change.

attributes.action: Change the Student Loan to allow Student Exchange Programs
attributes.background: The Government should allow the student loan scheme to include loans for Student/Foreign Exchange Programs for those wanting to go beyond the European grant of study grant which maybe abolished after Brexit which means the Government must inclue a scheme/loan for Student/Foreign Exchange Program.

attributes.action: Enable transfer of pension funds to lifetime ISA for use as a mortgage deposit
attributes.background: I struck upon an idea where you could possibly transfer a stakeholder pension into the new lifetime ISA coming soon.  The idea would be to only allow for security against a mortgage.
attributes.additional_details: I would suggest that the transferred fund would be exempt from the annual government bonus but attract normal interest.

attributes.action: Allow ALL tax payers to vote.
attributes.background: People who have no job and are claiming benefits but have been born in the UK are allowed to vote. People who were born elsewhere and moved here and are paying taxes and making a valuable contribution to the country they live in do NOT have the right to vote in the UK.

attributes.action: Relax immigration rules for elderly/disabled parents of British Citizens
attributes.background: my parents are in india. my father has been heart patient & had stroke last week and consequently become paralysis. my mother has been getting treatment of broken hips and can't look after my father.
attributes.additional_details: my parents are in india. my father has been heart patient & had stroke last week and consequently become paralysis. my mother has been getting treatment of broken hips and can't look after my father. I am married with 2 school attendee children in UK hence very stressful & difficult situation for me to go back India to look after my parents. Please allow me to bring my parents here in UK.

attributes.action: Establish an electoral system that requires an MP to receive 50% +1 of  turnout.
attributes.background: The UK electorate like to have an individual to vote for and be accountable. The current system allows an MP to take up a seat when the majority of constituents vote against them. Rendering them unaccountable.

attributes.action: A call for direct use of the military in Libya
attributes.background: The civil war in Libya is awful and needs to be stopped as it is allowing jihadist groups to gain control over the North of Africa, i believe we should but an end to this war with direct force

attributes.action: Amend the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2011 to allow for early General Elections
attributes.background: The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2011 should be changed to legislate for the triggering of a General Election when a change in leadership of the majority party results in the resignation of the Prime Minister whilst there is more than 20% of the defined 5 year parliamentary fixed term left to run.
attributes.additional_details: Often a change in leadership of a majority political party leads to a change of Prime Minister and a reshuffle of senior Cabinet posts. This can lead to changes in the political agenda of the Government that take it away from the platform on which it was elected. If the period between the date of appointment of a new Prime Minister and the date on which Parliament would be dissolved under the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2011 is more than a year, an early General Election should be triggered.

attributes.action: Only allow the UK to go to war after allowing the citizens to vote Yes or No.
attributes.background: The decision to go to war should not rest in the hands of the politicians. We voted them in to act in our best interests but it is obvious this is not the case. Going to war costs a massive amount of money, time and lives. We should protect our country from invasion. Not invade others.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot Inquiry

attributes.action: to make telling jokes about child abuse illegal
attributes.background: i feel that people will tell child abuse jokes and think its funny and fine i strongly disagree with this going back decades,, protesting on building sites etc,,, before social media
attributes.additional_details: a guy was telling a michael jackson joke back in the mid nineties on a building site,, i said sorry mate don't like those kind of jokes,,, not fair on children,, him and i went toe to toe,, i didn't mind it seems many jokes about adults,, are offensive and wrong but jokes so called about children are fine,,, this is totally wrong,, totally

attributes.action: Make Slurry Tanks safer, an  alarm should sound & also inform authorities.
attributes.background: Slurry is a mixture of manure and water. Waste from animals are stored  during the winter when cattle are kept indoors, to be spread during the warmer months. It has to be broken up & mixed, to be spread. At the mixing stage the odourless & invisible gases are produced that can kill within seconds.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no such thing as a safe slurry tank. Gases are produced by bacteria during the decomposition of slurry, these can kill instantly. The gas settles in a cloud over the top of the slurry during mixing. 

It stays in these tanks maybe for a number of months and a lethal combination of gases build up, including methane, carbon dioxide, ammonia, and worst of all, probably, hydrogen sulphide.

attributes.action: Add Black English to the national census
attributes.background: In England and Wales, non-white ethnic groups, as such, are not offered the standard option of including ‘English’ as part of their ethnic group: they’re officially classified only as ‘Black British’, ‘Asian British’, etc., and not ‘Black English’ or ‘Asian English’.
attributes.additional_details: By contrast, black and Asian persons living in Scotland are permitted to identify as ‘Black Scottish’ and ‘Asian Scottish’.English people" are both a nation and an ethnic group, having white skin is not a requirement.

attributes.action: Provide visas for 1st degree relatives of international students for graduation
attributes.background: International students are expected to pay university fees far in excess of their British counterparts and therefore pay much more towards improving and maintaining the universities. Sadly, we often turn our backs on these people by refusing their family visas to attend their graduation.

attributes.action: Give all UK Residents with NI number a vote. No taxation without representation.
attributes.background:
At 16 someone can legally leave school, get a job and pay tax. But they are denied a vote in General Elections on how that tax is spent.

The same is true for hard-working UK residents without UK citizenship. 

To address this iniquity give everyone with a National Insurance number a vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Current eligibility rules for voting in General Election (Electoral Commission)
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/i-am-a/voter/registering-to-vote-and-the-electoral-register

Current eligibility rules for National Insurance number (HMRC)
https://www.gov.uk/apply-national-insurance-number

attributes.action: Brexit talks by committee of 65, on the basis of proportional representation.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has now voted to leave the EU, to ensure that the negotiations are carried out with every person from every political background being represented I propose a committee carry out the talks based on a Proportional Representation distribution of seats from the last General election.
attributes.additional_details:
This is the biggest political event in our life times, no one party should be tarred with the negotiations of extracting the United Kingdom from the EU.
All parts of society need to feel 'United' in a common goal and see first hand that their voice is being heard.
The Scottish, Welsh, Irish, Labour, Conservatives, Lib dems, Greens, Ukip all represent the United Kingdom.... Let us Unite for the common good where no one is left behind unheard.

attributes.action: Start a fund to help EU nationals obtain their permanent residence cards
attributes.background: This petition asks that the government considers starting a fund to help all EU nationals that wish to become British citizens pay for their permanent residence cards and associated lawyer’s fees, allowing them to further integrate with the UK before it leaves the EU.
attributes.additional_details: EU nationals that have migrated to the UK have a net positive contribution to the UK economy. These EU nationals now face having to obtain a permanent residence card to remain in the UK or obtain British citizenship, a requirement to vote on decisions affecting their future. Before November 12th 2015 there was no requirement for citizens of EU countries to obtain a permanent residence card. There is no guarantee that EU and EEA citizens will be able to remain without one. http://bit.ly/1RJEOMm

attributes.action:
New Bank Holiday.
The Epiphany should be a national bank holiday.
attributes.background: I always have to work the Epiphany and I feel that this is not correct. Whilst other cultures are allowed extra time off work to celebrate their beliefs, myself and many others are denied this opportunity. If it was a Bank Holiday, everybody could unite, join in and celebrate this event.
attributes.additional_details:
Epiphany is a public holiday in countries such as Austria, Colombia, Croatia, Cyprus, Poland, Ethiopia (but on different date that varies annually), parts of Germany, Greece, Italy, Slovakia, Spain, and Uruguay. 

http://www.timeanddate.com/holidays/common/epiphany

attributes.action: Discuss the establishment of a rival EU 'London based Global trading group'.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom's decision to leave the EU has created an ideal opportunity to create a separate trading group outside of and free of the influences of the EU. Based in London, the new trading group will operate in a new purpose built center, whose sole focus will be economy and trade.
attributes.additional_details: The UK's decision to leave the EU is a fantastic chance to create a truly global trading group. With the UK's strong links to her commonwealth countries(both former and present), the United States, China and Japan, the establishment of a new economic trading group based in London in new, purpose headquarters will undoubtedly attract existing members of the EU who are reluctant to leave. The strengths of the new Pan trading group, is the absence of politics and its location in a truly global city.

attributes.action: Following EU exit vote make UK tax haven to maintain/entice economic investment.
attributes.background: There is a strong potential that foreign investment will be negatively impacted following the EU exit vote, with markets & currencies already slumping. I am suggesting the UK becomes a tax haven (with subsequent tax reform) to assist in maintaining & promoting foreign investment & economic growth.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for neighbours to record you & your property with CCTV!
attributes.background:
Currently, there are no laws governing the use of domestic CCTV  which impacts the neighbouring resident's privacy. Neighbours are able to record you, your family & your property. LEGALLY

Your privacy can be taken away from you & placed in the hands of your neighbours! PROTECT YOUR PRIVACY!
attributes.additional_details:
My neighbour has recently installed CCTV which captures the whole of my garden. He now has 24/7 access to my whole garden and is able to sit and watch us from his smart phone whenever he wishes! 

We have asked him to move the cameras as we have children and would prefer that they are not recorded! He has refused and there is nothing we can about it but to create this petition in hopes that you will sign to help bring back our privacy. 

We need to protect ourselves and our families! PLEASE SIGN

attributes.action: We call for the dualling of A120 between Marks Tey  and Braintree
attributes.background: This road is becoming more and more dangerous as the road was not designed to take heavy traffic, and there are so many accidents on this stretch of road that local roads become impassable.
attributes.additional_details: every couple of months there is a serious accident so much so that the queue can stretch right back to the Roundabout linking to the dualled section of the A120. This causes chaos and it can become blocked from Coggeshall as well towards Colchester. This really is not good enough the government is messing us around, something needs doing now!
